name: Decomposition of patenting rates for commuting zones based on level of urbanization
description: Decomposition of patenting rates for commuting zones based on level of urbanization

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: value
variableMeasured.unitText: Rate and composition factors pertaining to patenting

notes: RF is patents per inventive class member, and CF is inventive class as a share of total commuting zone population. In a departure from Wojan, Dotzel, and Low (2015), all Hawaiian and Alaskan commuting zones (including Aleutians West Census Area, AK, part of the Seattle, WA, commuting zone) are omitted. This change results in slight discrepancies in observed patenting rates across studies.
sources: U.S. Patent and Trademark Office; Census Bureau, special tabulations (2015) of the 2000 Census.
